sourceNotes: Editorial guidance prepared by Pitchchat; not sourced from user submissions.
title: Aerospace Seed fundraising metrics benchmarks
summary: Seed-stage aerospace metrics focus on technical progress, team strength, and early commercial validation. Unlike software startups, aerospace companies are measured on development milestones and risk reduction rather than revenue growth. These benchmarks help investors assess your technical and commercial maturity. Pitchchat keeps fundraising metrics investor-ready in one room.

metrics.label: Technology Readiness Level
metrics.note: NASA's TRL scale is the standard measure. Seed companies should have lab-validated technology (TRL 4) progressing toward relevant environment testing (TRL 5-6).

metrics.label: Manufacturing Readiness Level
metrics.note: For hardware companies, MRL indicates production scalability. Seed stage typically shows prototype component capability in lab environment.

metrics.label: Non-Dilutive Funding Secured
metrics.note: SBIR Phase I/II, NASA contracts, DoD funding provide technical validation and extend runway without dilution.

metrics.label: Letters of Intent
metrics.note: Customer or partner LOIs demonstrate market interest. Government program interest or prime contractor engagement counts heavily.

metrics.label: Patent Applications
metrics.note: IP protection is important in aerospace. Provisional or full utility patents on core technology show defensibility.

metrics.label: Team Size
metrics.note: Small but capable team with deep aerospace expertise. Key roles: technical lead, systems engineer, business development.

metrics.label: Prototype Status
metrics.note: Seed-stage companies typically have validated key components or subsystems, not full systems.

metrics.label: Regulatory Engagement
metrics.note: Evidence of regulatory pathway planning: FAA pre-application meetings, FCC filings, ITAR classification.

metrics.label: Development Timeline
metrics.note: Realistic timeline to major technical demonstration or prototype. Aerospace timelines are longer than software.

metrics.label: Capital Raised
metrics.note: Total capital raised to date including non-dilutive. Aerospace seed rounds tend to be larger than software given capital intensity.
